description: In Kanarsi, a village on New Delhi’s rural fringe, physicians at a pop-up cancer screening clinic on a sweltering day in June are trying to persuade women to go for cervical inspections.
title: India Is Ground Zero in Battling a Cancer That Kills a Woman Every 7 Minutes

description: Japan and Thailand top the list of Asian destinations for Chinese tourists heading abroad this summer, as the world’s biggest market of travelers look for holidays that offer good value.
title: These Are the Most Popular Destinations for China Tourists This Summer

description: The top scorer in the history of Colombia’s national team is coming home, but only for six months because he doesn’t want to pay the nation’s wealth tax.
title: Colombia’s Top-Scoring Soccer Star Balks at National Wealth Tax

description: A Nevada state judge on Friday dismissed charges against six individuals involved in the false certification of former President Donald Trump as the winner of the state’s 2020 presidential election.
title: Trump ‘Fake Electors’ Prosecution in Nevada Dismissed by Court

description: Automotive and environmental groups are at odds over how far Canada should go in imposing new tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles, as Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government weighs levies to protect the domestic industry.
title: Canada’s China EV Tariff Plan Draws Debate Over Best Approach

description: Labour leader Keir Starmer suggested that he will continue a freeze on fuel duty that has been a boon for UK drivers if his party wins the upcoming election.
title: Starmer Hints at Continuing Fuel Duty Freeze for UK Drivers

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, campaign finance reporter Bill Allison looks at presidential campaign fundraising and spending. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Catching Biden on Campaign Cash But Not on Spending It

description: Teamsters union president Sean O’Brien will speak at the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee next month, former President Donald Trump announced, a move that could undercut President Joe Biden’s appeal to blue-collar, union workers.
title: Teamsters President to Speak at Republican National Convention

description: The US Justice Department told attorneys for families of victims of two fatal 737 Max crashes that it still hasn’t decided whether to pursue criminal charges against Boeing Co., after determining last month the planemaker had breached a 2021 agreement with the government.
title: DOJ Says It Still Hasn’t Decided Whether to Prosecute Boeing

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva called central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto a “political and ideological adversary,” escalating his criticism of the monetary authority after policymakers halted a yearlong easing cycle this week.
title: Lula Blasts Central Bank Chief as ‘Adversary’ After Rate Hold

description: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss were refunded after their Bitcoin donations to Donald Trump’s presidential campaign exceeded the maximum amount allowed under federal law.
title: Winklevoss Twins Refunded After Trump Crypto Gift Exceeded Limit

description: The expansion of NATO and the European Union into eastern Europe is to blame for Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, according to Nigel Farage, leader of the populist Reform UK party surging in the polls.
title: NATO and EU to Blame for Ukraine War, Reform UK’s Farage Says

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is cultivating relationships with corporate America’s top ranks, offering an olive branch to a group that is showing signs of breaking heavily for Republican Donald Trump in November’s election.
title: Wall Street Brass Courted by Harris as Trump Makes 2024 Inroads

description: Investors are demanding the biggest premium in over a decade to hold French bonds compared to safer German debt, as concerns mount that parties vying to win France’s upcoming legislative elections may further bloat public finances.
title: France’s Risk Premium Over Germany Closes at Highest Since 2012

description: The Biden administration advanced plans to restrict investments by US individuals and companies into China, with a focus on curbing Beijing’s ability to gain ground in semiconductors, quantum computing and artificial intelligence.
title: US Moves Closer to Restricting Outbound Investment in China for Chips, AI Tech

description: Thousands of youths have taken to the streets of Nairobi, Kenya’s capital, and other towns to demand the withdrawal of additional taxes on items ranging from bread and diapers to imported wheelchair tires. The protests have turned violent, with police using teargas, water cannons and live bullets to disperse the crowds. At least one person has died, dozens have been injured and hundreds have been arrested. While lawmakers from the ruling coalition have proposed amendments to the taxes to help co
title: Why Anti-Tax Protests in Kenya Have Ruto in a Bind

description: Four members of the billionaire Hinduja family were found guilty of illegally exploiting poorly paid servants at their luxury Geneva villa, in a damning verdict for the Swiss branch of one of India’s wealthiest and most influential clans.
title: Hindujas Found Guilty of Exploiting Servants at Geneva Villa

description: Thailand’s lower house of parliament voted in support of a $102 billion budget for next fiscal year that seeks to ramp up state spending to drive growth in Southeast Asia’s second largest economy.
title: Thailand’s $102 Billion Budget Gets Initial Nod From Lawmakers

description: The general election is in a week and six days. Labour has dipped to its lowest level of the campaign so far (41.8%, still 20.8 points ahead of the Conservatives) in Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Ailbhe Rea and Helen Chandler-Wilde: Tory woes and Labour plans

description: Steve Bannon, a longtime adviser to former President Donald Trump, is asking the US Supreme Court to keep him out of prison while he fights to overturn his conviction for contempt of Congress.
title: Bannon Asks Supreme Court to Keep Him Out of Jail During Appeal

description: Two of Britain’s opposition parties reported a bonanza of donations greater than what Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservative Party collected in the second week of campaigning for the general election.
title: Labour and Reform Lead UK Conservatives on Campaign Donations

description: The streets of Toronto’s Forest Hill neighborhood are lined with arching maple trees and multimillion-dollar homes, a plummy refuge for some of Canada’s wealthiest families and top business leaders. Now it’s also a red-hot political battleground in the fight to control the country’s highest office.
title: Trudeau’s Future Is Tied to the Vote of a Rich Toronto Neighborhood

description: China fleshed out laws aimed at punishing supporters of independence for Taiwan, a move intended to pile pressure on the island’s new president.
title: China Fleshes Out Laws Targeting Backers of Taiwan Independence

description: The European Union formally agreed to open negotiations with Ukraine and Moldova over membership in the bloc, an important symbolic step in a process that will take years to play out.
title: EU to Open Membership Talks With Ukraine, Moldova Next Week

description: France’s leftist alliance unveiled plans to address the country’s fiscal challenges with a vast increase in public spending and to abolish several of Emmanuel Macron’s pro-business reforms.
title: French Left Alliance Says First Measures to Cost EU25 Billion

description: Slovakia’s Russia-friendly government accused its predecessor of treason and abuse of public office over military aid sent to Ukraine.
title: Slovakia Accuses Past Cabinet of Treason Over Army Aid for Kyiv

description: Zambia plans to supplement its 2024 spending plan by 41.9 billion kwacha ($1.6 billion) to deal with a severe drought and to start servicing its now restructured external loans.
title: Zambia Plans $1.6 Billion Budget Boost for Drought and Debt

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally has increased its lead slightly just nine days away from the first round of France’s snap legislative election, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Bloomberg French Poll of Polls: Le Pen’s Far Right Inches Higher

description: Estonia said it’s considering a second closure of the Baltic country’s main frontier post with Russia in as many days to ease congestion that left some travelers waiting overnight.
title: Lines at Border With Russia Leave Estonia Mulling Halt to Travel

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Expanding BRICS Helps Xi and Putin Challenge the West

description: The opposition Labour Party dipped to its lowest level of the British election campaign so far as Nigel Farage’s insurgent Reform UK Party registered a fifth record in a row in Bloomberg’s poll of polls on Friday.
title: Labour Dips as Reform Marches On, Poll of Polls Show

description: One person was killed and dozens more injured in a police crackdown on Kenyan protests against proposed tax hikes as the country braces for more marches next week when lawmakers take a final vote on the controversial levies.
title: One Dead as Kenya Braces for More Gen Z Anti-Tax Marches

description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida announced extra utility assistance and an extension of gasoline subsidies to help households cope with inflation.
title: Kishida Adds Extra Utility Subsidies and Keeps Gasoline Help

description: A Labour government might have to increase taxes on the wealthiest Britons to get the national debt falling, according to a new analysis.
title: Labour May Need to Raise Taxes on UK’s Wealthy, Economists Say

description: Estonia is blocking a reform of VAT which would impose new liabilities on digital platforms including short-term accommodation and passenger transport companies such as Bolt Technology OU and Airbnb Inc.
title: Estonia Blocks New EU Tax Rules That Would Have Hit Airbnb, Bolt

description: Musk, father of at least 12, has been quietly buying mainstream respectability for fringe theories about a coming population collapse.
title: Elon Musk Wants You to Have More Babies

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban has said that he plans to make institutions he considers financiers of the war in Ukraine cover the costs of a fine the European Union has imposed on Hungary for failing to comply with its asylum policies.
title: Hungary’s Orban Hints at Passing EU Penalties on to Financiers

description: France’s leftist alliance plans public spending of €200 billion ($214 billion) for its priorities over the next five years if it wins the snap election as it seeks to reverse President Emmanuel Macron’s labor and pension reforms and boost growth.
title: France’s Melenchon Says Left Alliance to Spend €200 Billion

description: For much of 2024, European bank stocks were the leaders of the region’s equities rally. Then French President Emmanuel Macron threw a spanner in the works.
title: Europe’s Bank Stock Rally Threatened by Macron’s Election Call

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s trip to Asia won him support to maintain his grinding war on Ukraine while alarming powers such as South Korea, which is now considering supplying Kyiv with weapons that could change the battlefield.
title: Putin’s Rare Trip to Asian Security Partners Pays Dividends

description: Support for the far-right National Rally party of Marine Le Pen is rising ahead of the French legislative elections, according to a poll published Friday. A separate survey showed declining approval for President Emmanuel Macron.
title: Le Pen’s Party Gains Support in Poll; Macron Approval Drops

description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s approval rating fell six points to match a historic low, according to a poll on Friday.
title: Macron Approval Rating Falls to Match Previous Low

description: Malawi named Michael Bizwick Usi as the new vice president after his predecessor, Saulos Chilima, died in a plane crash last week.
title: Malawian Comedian Michael Usi Named as Vice President

description: German Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck is set to arrive in Beijing for talks with top leaders in the world’s No. 2 economy, with looming European tariffs on Chinese electric cars high on his agenda.
title: Germany’s Habeck Heads to Beijing For Talks as EV Tariffs Loom

description: A Malaysian opposition party is seeking by-elections in six parliamentary constituencies held by its former members in a move that risks support for Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s planned reforms.
title: Malaysia Opposition Sends Note to Parliament, Seeks By-Elections

description: At least two refineries in southern Russia were targeted and received damage in an overnight swarm attack from drones, which was one of the largest of its type since the war in Ukraine began.
title: Russian Refineries Targeted in Overnight Drone Swarm Attack

description: Taiwan lawmakers again voted to expand their powers to summon public officials, defying both protesters and President Lai Ching-te, who is now expected to ask the Constitutional Court to review the changes and suspend their implementation.
title: Taiwan Lawmakers Vote to Expand Their Powers, Defying President

description: The Nordic country has led the way in Europe in going cashless, but fast and easy digital commerce have left consumers and the state vulnerable to fraud.
title: Ditching Paper Money Makes Sweden a Haven for Digital Criminals

description: A naval force deployed by the European Union to protect vessels in the Red Sea needs to more than double in size because of escalating attacks by Iran-backed Houthi rebels, the head of the operation said.
title: Fending Off Houthis Requires Double the Fleet, EU Force Says

description: French President Emmanuel Macron spent much of his tenure persuading bankers and fund managers to flock to Paris after Brexit. His decision to call snap elections may give some in the industry pause.
title: Paris’s Rise as Finance Hub Seen at Risk After Macron’s Early Election Gamble

description: A new UK government should ensure that increases in the minimum wage don’t make hiring more workers prohibitively costly, according to Currys Plc Chief Executive Officer Alex Baldock.
title: Soaring Minimum Wage Hurts Job Creation, Currys CEO Warns Labour

description: South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops crossed the border and then retreated, in the third such incident this month on the heavily armed peninsula.
title: South Korea Fires Warning Shots After Third Border Breach by North’s Troops

description: Chinese customs data suggest the country is running a trade surplus that’s much bigger than the one reported in its balance of payments, and Beijing should clarify why the numbers are different, the US Treasury said.
title: China Should Explain Growing Anomaly in Trade Numbers, US Says

description: The US is dispatching a top diplomat to Vietnam on the heels of Russian President Vladimir Putin’s visit to the Southeast Asian country, which gave the Russian leader a 21-gun salute and vowed closer ties.
title: US to Send East Asia Diplomat to Vietnam After Putin Visit

description: President Joe Biden’s campaign raised $85 million in May, falling short of the total raised by Republican rival Donald Trump for a second straight month, a troubling development for the incumbent before their November rematch.
title: Biden Raises $85 Million But Falls Short of Trump’s May Haul

description: The threat of China slapping tariffs on the European Union’s pork is the last thing the continent’s beleaguered industry needs.
title: China’s Pork Probe Is Yet Another Blow for Struggling EU Farmers

description: China’s electric vehicle industry received at least $231 billion in government subsidies and aid from 2009 through to the end of last year, even as the amount of support per vehicle has declined, according to a new research.
title: China’s EV Makers Got $231 Billion in Aid Over Last 15 Years

description: As Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese Premier Li Qiang wrapped up separate meetings in Southeast Asia this week, the two partners in the BRICS economic bloc encountered a region keen to join a group seen as a hedge against Western-led institutions.
title: Xi and Putin Score Wins as More Asian Leaders Want to Join BRICS

description: Weeks ago, Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. was speaking of his deputy, Vice President Sara Duterte, in glowing terms. With Duterte resigning from his cabinet this week, the president’s “best friend forever” is set to become his most formidable challenger just two years into his six-year term.
title: Duterte Heir Signals Philippine Ambition With Break From Marcos
